intro: Breweria, commonly known as the "broom weed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, often yellow or white flowers arranged in clusters. The leaves are typically linear or lance-shaped, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Breweria species are generally herbaceous and can be annual or perennial depending on the species. These plants are known for their ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
